intro: Kunokale, commonly known as the Hawaiian false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Kunokale thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. It plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is valued for its ornamental beauty.
